content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

You can solve this problem in Julia using the built-in string manipulation methods. Here is a function that performs those operations:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(replace(lowercase(strip(col)), " ", "_"), "-", "_")
end
```

You can then use this function to clean your column names. For example, calling `clean_column("My Column")` would return `"my_column"`.
